## Reading Group on Martin Gardner's Games and Puzzles

#### by Jyothi Krishnan

##### Spring 2024 (Jan/Feb)

:::{.callout-note collapse="true" icon="false"}

##### About the Meetups

This is a reading group based on games and puzzles described by Martin Gardner across his various books and columns. Curated and presented by [Jyothi Krishnan](Jyothi Krishnan).


:::
:::{.callout-note collapse="true" icon="false"}

##### Target Audience
You will find this course interesting if

- you enjoy puzzles and/or games
- you are a Martin Gardner fan
- you are generally math-curious 

:::

:::{.callout-tip collapse="true" icon="false"}

##### Prerequisites
We make no assumptions, although we appreciate everyone bringing their enthusiasm along :)
:::

:::{.callout-tip collapse="true" icon="false"}

##### References

01. Hexaflexagons And Other Mathematical Diversions · The First Scientific American Book of Mathematical Puzzles and Games by Martin Gardner
02. The Second Scientific American Book Of Mathematical Puzzles And Diversions by Martin Gardner
03. New Mathematical Diversions by Martin Gardner · The Mathematical Association of America (MAA)
04. The Unexpected Hanging And Other Mathematical Diversions · A Classic Collection of Puzzles and Games From Scientific American ·  Martin Gardner
05. The Sixth Book of Mathematical Diversions by Martin Gardner
06. Mathematical Carnival by Martin Gardner · The Mathematical Association of America (MAA)
07. Mathematical Magic Show by Martin Gardner · The Mathematical Association of America (MAA)
08. Mathematical Circus by Martin Gardner · The Mathematical Association of America (MAA)
09. The Magic Numbers of Dr. MATRIX by Martin Gardner · Prometheus Books Buffalo, New York
10. Wheels, Life and Other Mathematical Amusements by Martin Gardner · W. H. Freeman and Company, New York
11. Knotted Doughnuts and Other Mathematical Entertainments by Martin Gardner · W. H. Freeman and Company, New York
12. Penrose Tiles to Trapdoor Ciphers... And the Return of Dr. Matrix by Martin Gardner · The Mathematical Association of America (MAA)
13. Fractal Music Hypercards and More... Mathematical Recreations from SCIENTIFIC AMERICAN Magazine by Martin Gardner
14. The Last Recreations Hydras, Eggs, and Other Mathematical Mystifications · The final collection of Martin Gardner's Mathematical Games column from Scientific American


:::
